Find the equation of the line of reflection between the fixed green and pink arrows.

[[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

(2)

[[feedback:prt1]]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

truefeedback.text:
Here is a worked solution:

To find the line of reflection between two shapes, you can join up similar points on each shape.
The line of reflection is then given by the perpendicular bisectors of all these lines.

You have correctly transformed the centre point of the pink arrow.
However, your resulting shape is not at the correct orientation.

You have correctly translated the shape after the reflection.
However, you reflected the shape in the \({@if refAxis="x" then "y" else "x"@}\) axis instead of the \({@refAxis@}\) axis.

You have performed the transformations in the wrong order.
You should have reflected the arrow first, and then translated it.

You have correctly reflected the pink arrow in the \({@refAxis@}\) axis.
However, you have then translated the shape by the vector {@matrix([first(ans2)-first(refCenB)],[second(ans2)-second(refCenB)])@}

You have correctly performed the {@if (ans2=refCenB and first(ans3)-first(tans3)+first(first(transVec))<=0.1 and second(ans3)-second(tans3)+first(second(transVec))<=0.1) then "reflection" else "translation"@} given.
However, you have not attempted to {@if (ans2=refCenB and first(ans3)-first(tans3)+first(first(transVec))<=0.1 and second(ans3)-second(tans3)+first(second(transVec))<=0.1) then "translate" else "reflect"@} the shape.

You have correctly transformed the green arrow.
However, you should have transformed the pink arrow.
